de.nixosoft.jlr

Class JLRConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.nixosoft.jlr.JLRConverter

  • public class JLRConverter
extends java.lang.Object
    The main function of this class is to parse a template file and create a concrete instance file by using Velocity (a Java-based template engine from Apache).

    In the context of JLR(Java LaTeX Report), it is used to create a LaTeX report file from a LaTeX template file.
    For example, this can be used for invoices where you want to change information like name, address, date etc.

    The following tutorials can be helpful for the use of JLR:
    http://www.nixo-soft.de/tutorials/jlr/JLRTutorial.html
    http://velocity.apache.org/engine/releases/velocity-1.7/user-guide.html

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Matthias Walter (matthias .walter@nixo-soft.de)

        public JLRConverter(java.io.File workingDir,
            java.lang.String logging)
        Constructs a JLRConverter and initialization of the Velocity Engine.
        Parameters:
        workingDir - The directory where the template files are located
        logging - The LogSystem, which is used by Velocity - e.g. "org.apache.velocity.runtime.log.NullLogChute"

        public boolean parse(java.lang.String inputString,
            java.io.File outputFile)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Parses an input string (instead of a file) and creates an output file by replacing keywords.
        Parameters:
        inputString - The string which shall be parsed
        outputFile - The output file which shall be created after parsing
        Returns:
        true if the parsing was successful, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

        Parses an input string (instead of a file) and creates an output file by replacing keywords.
        Parameters:
        inputString - The string which shall be parsed
        outputFile - The output file which shall be created after parsing
        charsetName - The charset used for the input and output file
        Returns:

        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - If the charset is not supported
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs
